Title.evidence: Timing of Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Colorectal Cancer: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with high-risk stage II or III nonmetastatic colorectal cancer were randomized

Participants.evidence: 5719 patients from 244 centers across 6 countries. Patients with high-risk stage II or III nonmetastatic colorectal cancer

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive 3 or 6 months of adjuvant chemotherapy with fluoropyrimidine and oxaliplatin

Objective.evidence: This study examines the association between chemotherapy timing and disease-free survival.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was disease-free survival over a median follow-up of 72 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 5719 patients, 914 were in the early-start group and 4805 in the late-start group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Five-year disease-free survival was 78.0% in the early-start group vs 73.2% in the late-start group (hazard ratio, 1.24; 95% CI, 1.06-1.46; P = .01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups (odds ratio, 0.82; 95% CI, 0.65-1.04; P = .09).
